const_AREA_CIRCLE_1: Circular area with a diameter of 3 cells (cross).
const_AREA_CIRCLE_2: Circular area with a diameter of 5 cells.
const_AREA_CIRCLE_3: Circular area with a diameter of 7 cells.
const_AREA_LASER_LINE: Laser-type effective area: line going from the chip/weapon's min range to its max range (or the first obstacle)
const_ENTITY_BULB: Represents the entity type of a bulb.
const_ENTITY_LEEK: Represents the entity type of a leek.
const_FIGHT_TYPE_SOLO: Fight type of of solo fights.
const_OPERATIONS_LIMIT: Maximum operations allowed for a leek during its turn.
const_PI: Relation between a circle's circonference and its diameter.
const_SORT_ASC: Indicates a sorting function to use ascending order.
const_SORT_DESC: Indicates a sorting function to use descending order.
const_USE_RESURRECT_INVALID_ENTITY: Return value of the function #resurrect when the specified entity does not exist or is not dead yet.
const_USE_TOO_MANY_SUMMONS: Error thrown by #summon when you already have 6 alive summons.
func_abs: Returns the absolute value of given number.
func_arrayConcat: Chains given arrays together. String keys are kept while numerical keys are reindexed.
func_arrayFilter: Returns an array containing all (key: value) pairs from given array for which callback function returned true. If the callback function is single-input, it is applied on the array's values, if the callback function requires two inputs, it is applied on the array's (key: value) pairs.
func_arrayFoldLeft: Reduces given array [v1, v2, ..., vn] from the left and starting with v0, through successive application of f function. Is equivalent to: f(f(f(v0, v1), v2), ...).
func_arrayFoldRight: Reduces given array [v1, v2, ..., vn] from the right and starting with v0, through successive application of f function. Is equivalent to: f(v1, f(v2, ..., f(vn, v0))).
func_arrayIter: Calls a callback function for each element within given array. If the callback function is single-input, it is applied on the array's values, if the callback function requires two inputs, it is applied on the array's (key: value) pairs.
func_arrayMap: Returns an array which contains the results of callback function when called on each element within given array (and indexed with the same keys as the original array). If the callback function is single-input, it is applied on the array's values, if the callback function requires two inputs, it is applied on the array's (key: value) pairs.
func_arrayMap_arg_2: Function to be applied on each element from given array.
func_arrayMax:
Finds the greatest value within given array.
See also: #sort.
func_arrayMax_return: The greatest value contained in given array.
func_arrayMin:
Finds the least value within given array.
See also: #sort.
func_arrayMin_return: The least value contained in given array.
func_arrayPartition: Returns a two elements array, each being a list of (key: value) pairs from given array. The first element contains pairs for which callback function returned true, and the second one contains all other pairs. If the callback function is single-input, it is applied on the array's values, if the callback
function: requires two inputs, it is applied on the array's (key: value) pairs.
func_assocSort: Sorts an array, while keeping the key: value coupling.
func_assocSort_2: Sorts an array, while keeping the key: value coupling, using given order.
func_atan2: Computes the azimuth of given point (x, y) in polar coordinates. Return value is between - #PI and #PI, depending on parameters' signs.
func_atan2_return: Azimuth of given point, in polar coordinates.
func_average: Computes the average of an array's elements.
func_canUseChip: Checks whether your leek can use given chip, targeting given leek.
func_canUseChip_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_canUseChipOnCell: Checks whether your leek can use given chip, targeting given cell.
func_canUseChipOnCell_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_canUseChipOnCell_return: true if your leek can use given chip, false otherwise.
func_canUseChip_return: true if your leek can use given chip, false otherwise.
func_canUseWeapon: Checks whether your leek can shoot its current weapon targeting given leek.
func_canUseWeapon_2: Checks whether your leek can shoot given weapon, targeting given leek.
func_canUseWeapon_2_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_canUseWeapon_2_return: true if your leek can shoot given weapon, false otherwise.
func_canUseWeaponOnCell: Checks whether your leek can shoot its current weapon targeting given cell.
func_canUseWeaponOnCell_2: Checks whether your leek can shoot given weapon, targeting given cell.
func_canUseWeaponOnCell_2_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_canUseWeaponOnCell_2_return: true if your leek can shoot given weapon, false otherwise.
func_canUseWeaponOnCell_return: true if your leek can shoot, false otherwise.
func_canUseWeapon_return: true if your leek can shoot, false otherwise.
func_cbrt: Computes the cubic root of given number.
func_ceil:
Computes the rounded up value of given number.
The rounded down value can be computed using #floor and the closest integer using #round.
func_ceil_return: Number's value as an integer, rounded up.
func_charAt:
Returns the character at given position within given string.
First character is at position 0.
func_charAt_arg_2: Position of the character to return.
func_charAt_return: Character from given position. Empty string if position is invalid.
func_chipNeedLos: Returns whether given chip requires a line of sight in order to be shot.
func_chipNeedLos_return: Returns whether given chip requires a line of sight in order to be shot.
func_contains: Checks whether search string is contained within string.
func_contains_arg_1: String in which the search is performed.
func_contains_return: true if search string is contained in string, false otherwise.
func_count: Counts the elements contained within an array.
func_debug: Logs an object message into your personnal log, available at the end of a fight.
func_debugC: Logs an object message into your personnal log, available at the end of a fight, of the color color.
func_debugC_arg_2: The message color. You can use the function #getColor.
func_debugE:
Logs an object error message into your personnal log, available at the end of a fight.
Error messages appear in red.
func_debugW:
Logs an object warning message into your personnal log, available at the end of a fight.
Warning messages appear in orange.
func_deleteRegister: Removes given key (and associated value) from your leek's register.
func_deleteRegister_arg_1: Key of the (key: value) pair to be deleted.
func_endsWith: Checks whether given string ends with given suffix
func_exp: Computes the exponential of number, by exponentiation of #E.
func_fill: Fills an array with value, i.e replaces all existing elements with value.
func_fill_2: Resizes array to given size and fills it with value.
func_floor:
Computes the rounded down value of given number.
The rounded up value can be computed using #ceil and the closest integer using #round.
func_floor_return: Number's value as an integer, rounded down.
func_getAbsoluteShield: Returns your leek's absolute shield value.
func_getAbsoluteShield_2:
Return a leek's absolute shield value.
For your leek, prefer #getAbsoluteShield() with no input.
func_getAbsoluteShield_2_arg_1: Leek whose absolute shield you want.
func_getAgility_2:
Returns given leek's agility.
For your leek's agility, prefer #getAgility() with no input.
func_getAIID: Returns the id of your AI.
func_getAIID_2: Returns the id of given leek's AI.
func_getAIID_2_arg_1: Leek whose AI ID you want.
func_getAIID_return: The id of your leek's AI.
func_getAIName: Returns the name of your AI.
func_getAIName_2: Returns the name of given leek's AI.
func_getAIName_2_arg_1: Leek whose AI name you want.
func_getAliveAllies: Returns an array containing all of your alive allies in a fight.
func_getAliveAllies_return: An array containing all of your alive allies in a fight.
func_getAliveEnemies: Returns an array containing all of your alive enemies in a fight.
func_getAliveEnemiesCount: Counts the alive enemies in the fight.
func_getAliveEnemies_return: An array containing all all of your alive enemies in a fight.
func_getAllies: Returns an array containing all of your allies in a fight.
func_getAlliesCount: Returns the number of allies in the fight.
func_getAlliesLife: Returns the sum of all of your allies' HP
func_getAlliesLife_return: Sum of all of your allies' HP.
func_getAllies_return: An array containing all of your allies in a fight.
func_getBirthTurn: Returns the turn during which caller has appeared. For instance, returns 1 for a leek or 5 for a bulb summonned during turn 5.
func_getBirthTurn_2: Returns the turn during which given entity has appeared. For instance, returns 1 for a leek or 5 for a bulb summonned during turn 5.
func_getBirthTurn_2_return: Combat turn during which given entity has appeared.
func_getBirthTurn_return: Combat turn during which caller has appeared.
func_getBlue: Returns the blue component of given color. For instance getBlue(#COLOR_BLUE) = 255 and getBlue(#COLOR_RED) = 0.
func_getBlue_arg_1: Color whose blue component is to be returned.
func_getCell: Returns your leek's position, as a cell id.
func_getCell_2: Returns given leek's position, as a cell id.
func_getCellContent_arg_1: id of the cell to be tested.
func_getCellDistance:
Computes the distance between cells cell1 and cell2.
Distance is in amount of cells and does not take obstacles into account.
For as a crow's flies distance, see #getDistance and for an actual path (taking obstacles into account), see #getPathLength.
func_getCellFromXY: Returns the id of the cell at coordinates (x, y).
func_getCellFromXY_return: id of the cell at coordinates (x, y). null if it does not exist.
func_getCell_return: Cell id of your leek's position.
func_getCellsToUseChip: Lists all cells that allow your leek to use a given chip, targeting given leek.
func_getCellsToUseChip_2: Lists all cells that allow your leek to use a given chip, targeting given leek.
func_getCellsToUseChip_2_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseChip_2_return: List of all cells that allow using given chip.
func_getCellsToUseChip_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseChipOnCell: Lists all cells that allow your leek to use a given chip, targeting given cell.
func_getCellsToUseChipOnCell_2: Lists all cells that allow your leek to use a given chip, targeting given cell.
func_getCellsToUseChipOnCell_2_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseChipOnCell_2_return: List of all cells that allow using given chip.
func_getCellsToUseChipOnCell_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseChipOnCell_return: List of all cells that allow using given chip.
func_getCellsToUseChip_return: List of all cells that allow using given chip.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon: Lists all cells that allow your leek to shoot its current weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_2: Lists all cells that allow your leek to shoot given weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_2_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_2_return: List of all cells that allow your leek to shoot given weapon.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_3: Lists all cells that allow your leek to shoot a given weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_3_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_3_return: List of all cells that allow your leek to shoot.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell: Lists all cells that allow your leek to shoot its current weapon, targeting given cell.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_2: Lists all cells that allow your leek to shoot given weapon, targeting given cell.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_2_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_2_return: List of all cells that allow your leek to shoot.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_3: Lists all cells that allow your leek to shoot a given weapon, targeting given cell.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_3_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_3_return: List of all cells that allow your leek to shoot.
func_getCellsToUseWeaponOnCell_return: List of all cells that allow your leek to shoot.
func_getCellsToUseWeapon_return: List of all cells that allow your leek to shoot.
func_getCellToUseChip: Finds a cell that allows your leek to use a given chip, targeting given leek.
func_getCellToUseChip_2: Finds a cell that allows your leek to use a given chip, targeting given leek.
func_getCellToUseChip_2_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseChip_2_return: A cell that allows using given chip.
func_getCellToUseChip_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseChipOnCell: Finds a cell that allows your leek to use a given chip, targeting given cell.
func_getCellToUseChipOnCell_2: Finds a cell that allows your leek to use a given chip, targeting given cell.
func_getCellToUseChipOnCell_2_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseChipOnCell_2_return: A cell that allows using the given chip on targeted cell.
func_getCellToUseChipOnCell_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseChipOnCell_return: A cell that allows using given chip.
func_getCellToUseChip_return: A cell that allows using given chip.
func_getCellToUseWeapon: Finds a cell that allows your leek to shoot its current weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_2: Finds a cell that allows your leek to shoot given weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_2_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_2_return: A cell that allows your leek to shoot.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_3: Finds a cell that allows your leek to shoot given weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_3_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_3_return: A cell that allows using given weapon.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell: Finds a cell that allows your leek to shoot its current weapon, targeting given cell.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_2: Finds a cell that allows your leek to shoot given weapon, targeting given leek.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_2_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_2_return: A cell that allows your leek to shoot.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_3: Finds a cell that allows your leek to shoot given weapon, targeting given cell.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_3_arg_1: The weapon your leek wants to use.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_3_return: A cell that allows using given weapon on targeted cell.
func_getCellToUseWeaponOnCell_return: A cell that allows your leek to shoot.
func_getCellToUseWeapon_return: A cell that allows your leek to shoot.
func_getChipArea_return:
Given chip's effective area type among AREA_* constants:
  • #AREA_POINT: single-cell effective area
  • #AREA_LASER_LINE: laser-type effective area (line)
  • #AREA_CIRCLE_1: circular effective area with 3 cells diameter (cross)
  • #AREA_CIRCLE_2: circular effective area with 5 cells diameter
  • #AREA_CIRCLE_3: circular effective area with 7 cells diameter.
func_getChipCooldown: Returns a chip's cooldown as shown in the market.
func_getChipEffectiveArea: Lists the cells affected if given chip were used on given cell.
func_getChipEffectiveArea_2: Lists the cells affected if given chip were used on given cell from from cell.
func_getChipEffectiveArea_2_arg_3: Cell from which the chip is used.
func_getChipEffectiveArea_2_return: Array that contains the id of all affected cells.
func_getChipEffectiveArea_return: Array that contains the id of all affected cells.
func_getChipEffects_return: Given chip's effects. Format is the same as #getWeaponEffects
func_getChipFailure_return: Given chip's failure rate, in percents, integer between 0 and 100.
func_getChips_2_return: Array containing all of given leek's chips.
func_getChips_return: Array containing all of your leek's chips.
func_getChipTargets: Lists leeks that will be affected if given chip were used on given cell.
func_getColor: Gives an integer that corresponds to given color on a (red, green, blue) scale. See #mark on how to use given integer.
func_getColor_return: Integer that corresponds to given color.
func_getCooldown: Returns the current cooldown of given chip for your leek.
func_getCooldown_2: Returns the current cooldown of given chip for given leek.
func_getCooldown_2_return: Given chip's current cooldown, i.e. the amount of turns owner must wait to cast it again.
func_getCores: Returns your leek's number of cores.
func_getDeadEnemiesCount: Counts the dead enemies in the fight.
func_getDistance:
Computes as the crow flies distance between cell1 and cell2.
For distance in number of cells, see #getCellDistance, and for an actual path (taking obstacles into account), see #getPathLength.
func_getDistance_return: Crow's fly distance between given cells.
func_getEffects: Lists the effects affecting your leek.
func_getEffects_2: Lists the effects affecting given leek. For your leek, prefer #getEffects() with no input.
func_getEffects_2_return:
Array of effects affecting given leek. An effect itself is a 7-cell array of the following form: [type, b>value, caster_id, turns, critical, item_id, target_id], with type describing the type of effect, among:
  • #EFFECT_DAMAGE, value is the amount of damage
  • #EFFECT_HEAL, value is the number of HP healed
  • #EFFECT_BUFF_FORCE, value is the added strength
  • #EFFECT_BUFF_AGILITY, value is the added agility
  • #EFFECT_BUFF_TP, value is the number of added TP
  • #EFFECT_BUFF_MP, valueis the number of added MP
  • #EFFECT_ABSOLUTE_SHIELD, value is the absolute shield gained
  • #EFFECT_RELATIVE_SHIELD, value is the relative shield gained
  • #EFFECT_DEBUFF, indicates a debuff, value is not significant.
  • etc.
func_getEffects_return: Array of effects affecting your leek. More details in #getEffects(leek).
func_getEnemies: Lists all enemies (dead and alive) within a fight.
func_getEnemiesCount: Counts the enemies in the fight.
func_getEnemiesLife: Returns the sum of all of your enemies' HP
func_getEnemiesLife_return: Sum of all of your enemies' HP
func_getEnemies_return: Array containing leek ids of all enemies.
func_getEntityTurnOrder: Indicates the position of the caller in the acting order, between 1 and the amount of entities in the game.
func_getEntityTurnOrder_2: Indicates the position of given entity in the acting order, between 1 and the amount of entities in the game.
func_getEntityTurnOrder_2_return: Given entity's position within the acting order.
func_getEntityTurnOrder_return: Caller's position within the acting order.
func_getFarmerCountry_return: Your farmer country, or "?" if not specified.
func_getFarmerCountry_2_return: The country of given farmer, or "?" if not specified.
func_getFarmerID_2: Returns the id of the given farmer.
func_getFarmerName_2: Returns the name of given leek's farmer.
func_getFarthestAlly: Returns the farthest ally, using as the crow flies distance.
func_getFarthestEnemy: Returns the farthest enemy, using as the crow flies distance.
func_getFightContext_return: Depending on fight's context: Test fight (#FIGHT_CONTEXT_TEST), Garden fight (#FIGHT_CONTEXT_GARDEN), Tournament fight (#FIGHT_CONTEXT_TOURNAMENT), Challenge fight (#FIGHT_CONTEXT_CHALLENGE).
func_getFightType_return: Depending on fight's type: Solo fight (#FIGHT_TYPE_SOLO), Farmer fight (#FIGHT_TYPE_FARMER), Team fight (#FIGHT_TYPE_TEAM).
func_getGreen: Returns the green component of given color. For instance getGreen(#COLOR_GREEN) = 255 and getGreen(#COLOR_BLUE) = 0.
func_getGreen_arg_1: Color whose green component is to be returned.
func_getInstructionsCount: Returns the number of instructions used by your leek this turn.
func_getInstructionsCount_return: The number of instructions used by your leek this turn.
func_getLaunchedEffects: Returns the list of effects launched by the caller.
func_getLaunchedEffects_2: Returns the list of effects launched by given leek.
func_getLaunchedEffects_2_return: Array containing all effects launched by the caller, similar to #getEffets' results.
func_getLaunchedEffects_return: Array containing all effects launched by the caller, similar to #getEffets' results.
func_getLeekID: Returns your leek's absolute id (does not depend on fight).
func_getLeekOnCell: Returns the leek present on given cell, if any.
func_getLeekOnCell_return: The leek id of a leek that is currently occupying given cell, -1 if cell is not occupied by a leek.
func_getMapType: Returns the map type on which the fight takes place (factory, desert, forest, etc.), among the constants #MAP_NEXUS, #MAP_FACTORY, #MAP_DESERT, #MAP_FOREST, #MAP_GLACIER and #MAP_BEACH.
func_getMessages: Lists all messages addressed to you.
func_getMessages_2: Lists all messages addressed to given leek.
func_getMessages_2_return: Array of messages addressed to given leek.
func_getMessages_return:
Array of messages.
A message itself is a 3-cell array of the following form: [author, type, parameters]
Message types are:
  • #MESSAGE_HEAL: request for heal
  • #MESSAGE_ATTACK: request for attack
  • #MESSAGE_BUFF_FORCE: request for strength buff
  • ...
func_getNearestAlly: Returns the allied leek closest to your leek.
func_getNearestAllyTo: Returns, among your allies, the closest one to given leek.
func_getNearestAllyToCell: Returns, among your allies, the closest one to given cell.
func_getNearestAllyToCell_return: Leek id of your ally that is closest to given cell.
func_getNearestAllyTo_return: Leek id of your ally that is closest to given leek.
func_getNearestEnemy: Returns the enemy leek closest to your leek.
func_getNearestEnemyTo: Returns, among your enemies, the closest one to given leek.
func_getNearestEnemyToCell: Returns, among your enemies, the closest one to given cell.
func_getNearestEnemyToCell_return: Leek id of your enemy that is closest to given cell.
func_getNearestEnemyTo_return: Leek id of your enemy that is closest to given leek.
func_getNextPlayer: Returns the leek id of the next leek to play.
func_getNextPlayer_return: Leek id of the next player.
func_getObstacles: Lists all cells that are occupied by obstacles.
func_getObstacles_return: Array of cells occupied by obstacles.
func_getOperations: Returns the operations' counter, as started at the beginning of turn. This counter needs to stay below #OPERATIONS_LIMIT in order for the leek not to stop processing.
func_getOperations_return: Count of operations since the beginning of the turn.
func_getPath: Finds a path between cell1 and cell2, avoiding occupied cells.
func_getPath_2: Finds a path between cell1 and cell2, avoiding occupied cells, except ignoredCells, which are considered empty even when a leek occupies them.
func_getPath_2_arg_3: Array of cells considered inoccupied even when a leek is present.
func_getPath_2_return: Array of cells that build a path between given cells. Considering ignoredCells as empty. Empty array if no path is found.
func_getPathLength:
Returns the length of a path between cell1 and cell2 that avoids occupied cells. This function is equivalent to count(getPath(cell1, cell2)).

For as a crow's flies distance, see #getDistance and for distance in number of cells, see #getCellDistance
func_getPathLength_2: Returns the length of a path between cell1 and cell2 that avoids occupied cells, except ignoredCells which are considered empty even when a leek is present.
func_getPathLength_2_arg_3: Array of cells considered inoccupied even when a leek is present.
func_getPathLength_2_return: Length of the path between cell1 and cell2. -1 if no path is found.
func_getPathLength_return: Length of the path between cell1 and cell2. -1 if no path is found.
func_getPath_return: Array of empty cells that build a path between given cells. Empty array if no path is found.
func_getPreviousPlayer: Returns the leek id of the leek who just played.
func_getPreviousPlayer_return: Leek id of the leek who just played.
func_getRed: Returns the red component of given color. For instance getRed(#COLOR_RED) = 255 and getRed(#COLOR_BLUE) = 0.
func_getRed_arg_1: Color whose red component is to be returned.
func_getRegister: Returns the value associated to given key in your leek's register, null if it is not found.
func_getRegister_return: The value associated to given key in your leek's register.
func_getRegisters_return: Your leek's register, as an associative array.
func_getRelativeShield_2: Returns given leek's relative shield. For your leek's relative shield, prefer #getRelativeShield() with no input.
func_getRelativeShield_2_return: Given leek's relative shield, in percents: integer between 0 and 100.
func_getRelativeShield_return: Your leek's relative shield, in percents: integer between 0 and 100.
func_getSummoner: Returns caller's summoner, if caller is a summon.
func_getSummoner_2: Returns given entity's summoner, if it is a summon.
func_getSummoner_2_return: ID of the entity's sumonner, if given entity is a summon, null otherwise.
func_getSummoner_return: ID of the summoning entity, if caller is a summon, null otherwise.
func_getTeamID_2: Returns the id of given leek's team.
func_getTeamName_2: Returns the name of given leek's team.
func_getTotalMP: Returns caller's total MP count (not counting this turn's movements).
func_getTotalMP_2: Returns given leek's total MP count (not counting this turn's movements).
func_getTotalTP: Returns caller's total TP count (not counting this turn's actions).
func_getTotalTP_2: Returns given leek's total TP count (not counting this turn's actions).
func_getTurn: Returns current turn's count. Maximum duration of a fight is #MAX_TURNS.
func_getType_2_return:
Given entity's type:
  • #ENTITY_LEEK if given entity is a leek.
  • #ENTITY_BULB if given entity is a bulb.
func_getType_return:
Caller's entity type:
  • #ENTITY_LEEK if called by a leek.
  • #ENTITY_BULB if called by a bulb.
func_getWeapon: Returns the weapon currently equipped by your leek.
func_getWeapon_2: Returns the weapon currently equipped by given leek.
func_getWeapon_2_return: The weapon's id, null if given leek has no equipped weapon.
func_getWeaponArea_return:
Given weapon's effective area type among AREA_* constants:
  • #AREA_POINT: single-cell effective area
  • #AREA_LASER_LINE: laser-type effective area (line)
  • #AREA_CIRCLE_1: circular effective area with 3 cells diameter (cross)
  • #AREA_CIRCLE_2: circular effective area with 5 cells diameter
  • #AREA_CIRCLE_3: circular effective area with 7 cells diameter.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea: Lists the cells affected if your leek's current weapon were shot on given cell.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea_2: Lists the cells affected if given weapon were shot on given cell.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea_2_return: Array that contains the id of all affected cells.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea_3: Lists the cells affected if given weapon were shot on given cell, from from cell.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea_3_arg_3: Cell from which the chip is used.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea_3_return: Array that contains the id of all affected cells.
func_getWeaponEffectiveArea_return: Array that contains the id of all affected cells.
func_getWeaponEffects_return:
Array containing given's weapon effects. An effect itself if an array, in the following format: [type, min, max, turns, targets].
  • type is an effect type, among: #EFFECT_DAMAGE, #EFFECT_HEAL, #EFFECT_ABSOLUTE_SHIELD, #EFFECT_RELATIVE_SHIELD, #EFFECT_DEBUFF, #EFFECT_BUFF_FORCE, #EFFECT_BUFF_AGILITY, #EFFECT_BUFF_MP, #EFFECT_BUFF_TP etc.
  • min and max are the min and max values of the effect (from the market).
  • turns is the duration of the effect, in turns.
  • targets gives which players can be affected. It is a binary construct of:
    • #EFFECT_TARGET_ALLIES: Affects allies
    • #EFFECT_TARGET_ENEMIES: Affects enemies
    • #EFFECT_TARGET_CASTER: Always affects caster
    • #EFFECT_TARGET_NOT_CASTER: Cannot affect caster
    • #EFFECT_TARGET_SUMMONS : Affects caster's summons
    • #EFFECT_TARGET_NON_SUMMONS : Affects leeks
    It can be parsed with:
    if (targets & EFFECT_TARGET_ALLIES) debug('Affects allies'); if (targets & EFFECT_TARGET_ENEMIES) debug('Affects enemies'); if (targets & EFFECT_TARGET_CASTER) debug('Always affects caster'); if (targets & EFFECT_TARGET_NOT_CASTER) debug('Cannot affect caster'); if (targets & EFFECT_TARGET_SUMMONS) debug("Affects summons"); if (targets & EFFECT_TARGET_NON_SUMMONS) debug("Affects leeks");
func_getWeaponFailure_return: Given chip's failure rate, in percents, integer between 0 and 100.
func_getWeapon_return: The weapon's id, null if your leek has no equipped weapon.
func_getWeapons_2_return: Array containing all of given leek's weapons.
func_getWeapons_return: Array containing all of your leek's weapons.
func_getWeaponTargets: Lists leeks that will be affected if your leek's current weapon were used on given cell.
func_getWeaponTargets_2: Lists leeks that will be affected if given weapon were used on given cell.
func_hypot: Returns the hypothenuse of a right-angled triangle with sides x and y. Equivalent to sqrt(x**2 + y**2).
func_inArray: Checks whether given element is inside given array.
func_inArray_arg_1: Array in which search is performed.
func_inArray_return: true if given element is contained in array, false otherwise.
func_include:
Icludes the AI named ai inside current AI.

Warning: the include function shall only be called inside the main AI block, and its parameter shall NOT be a variable. More information in the tutorial: http://leekwars.com/help/tutorial#includes.
func_indexOf: Finds the first occurrence of search string within given string.
func_indexOf_2: Finds the first occurrence of search string within given string, starting at given position.
func_indexOf_2_arg_3: Position within string where the search starts.
func_indexOf_2_return: First matching substring's position , -1 if no match was found.
func_indexOf_return: First matching substring's position , -1 if no match was found.
func_insert: Inserts an element in an array, at given position.
func_insert_arg_1: Array in which element is added.
func_isAlive: Checks whether a leek is alive. Equivalent to getLife(leek) > 0.
func_isAlly: Checks whether a leek is your ally.
func_isAlly_return: true if leek is an ally (or you), false otherwise.
func_isChip:
Checks whether given value can represent a chip.

isChip(CHIP_RAGE) = true;
isChip(WEAPON_PISTOL) = false.
func_isDead: Checks whether a leek is dead. Equivalent to getLife(leek) == 0.
func_isEmpty: Checks whether given array is empty. Equivalent to count(array) == 0.
func_isEnemy: Checks whether a leek is your enemy.
func_isInlineChip: Checks whether given chip is inline, i.e. only usable if the target is in the same line as the caster.
func_isInlineWeapon: Checks whether given weapon is inline, i.e. only usable if the target is in the same line as the caster.
func_isLeek: Checks whether given cell is occupied by a leek.
func_isLeek_return: true if cell is occupied by a leek, false otherwise.
func_isObstacle: Checks whether given cell is occupied by an obstacle.
func_isObstacle_return: true if cell is occupied by an obstacle, false otherwise.
func_isOnSameLine: Checks whether cell1 and cell2 are on the same line.
func_isOnSameLine_return: true if cells are on the same line, false otherwise.
func_isSummon: Returns wether the caller is a summoned entity or not.
func_isSummon_2: Returns wether given entity is a summoned entity or not.
func_isSummon_2_return: true if given entity is a summoned entity, false otherwise.
func_isSummon_return: true if the caller is a summoned entity, false otherwise.
func_isWeapon:
Checks whether given value can represent a weapon.

isWeapon(WEAPON_LASER) = true;
isWeapon(CHIP_TELEPORTATION) = false.
func_join: Creates a single string containing all elements of given array, separated by glue delimiters.
func_join_arg_1: An array of elements to be joined into a string.
func_join_arg_2: A string that is inserted between consecutive elements of the array.
func_jsonDecode: Decode the string json into a LeekScript object (number, string, array...).
func_jsonEncode: Encode the object object into a JSON string.
func_jsonEncode_arg_1: The object to encode in JSON.
func_keySort_2: Sorts an array using key values, using given sorting order.
func_lineOfSight: Checks whether a leek on start cell can see end cell.
func_lineOfSight_2: Checks whether a leek on start cell can see end cell, ignoring given leek.
func_lineOfSight_2_arg_3:
Ignored leek (this leek will not block a line of sight).
Note: this input can also be an array containing several leeks.
func_lineOfSight_2_return: true if the line of sight is clear, false otherwise.
func_lineOfSight_return: true if the line of sight is clear, false otherwise.
func_listen: Lists say() performed by previous leeks, as [leek_id, message].
func_log: Computes the natural logarithm of given number.
func_log10: Computes the decimal logarithm of given number.
func_mark: Marks one or several cells on terrain in black, for one turn. The mark is only visible by the marking leek's farmer.
func_mark_2: Marks one or several cells on terrain in given color for one turn. The mark is only visible by the marking leek's farmer.
func_mark_2_arg_1: A cell or array of cells.
func_mark_3: Marks one or several cells on terrain in given color for the given duration. The mark is only visible by the marking leek's farmer.
func_mark_3_arg_1: A cell or array of cells.
func_mark_arg_1: A cell or array of cells.
func_max: Finds the greatest value among two numbers a and b.
func_max_return: The greatest of the two numbers.
func_min: Finds the least value among two numbers a and b.
func_min_return: The least of the two numbers.
func_moveAwayFrom: Moves your leek away from another leek.
func_moveAwayFrom_2: Moves your leek away from another leek, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveAwayFrom_2_arg_1: The leek from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFrom_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveAwayFrom_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveAwayFrom_arg_1: The leek from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromCell: Moves your leek away from given cell.
func_moveAwayFromCell_2: Moves your leek away from given cell, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveAwayFromCell_2_arg_1: The cell from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromCell_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveAwayFromCell_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveAwayFromCell_arg_1: The cell from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromCells: Moves your leek away from a given group of cells.
func_moveAwayFromCells_2: Moves your leek away from a given group of cells, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveAwayFromCells_2_arg_1: Array containing the cells from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromCells_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveAwayFromCells_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveAwayFromCells_arg_1: Array containing the cells from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromLeeks: Moves your leek away from a given group of leeks.
func_moveAwayFromLeeks_2: Moves your leek away from a given group of leeks, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveAwayFromLeeks_2_arg_1: Array containing the leeks from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromLeeks_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveAwayFromLeeks_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveAwayFromLeeks_arg_1: Array containing the leeks from which you want to flee.
func_moveAwayFromLine: Moves your leek away from the line between cell1 and cell2.
func_moveAwayFromLine_2: Moves your leek away from the line between cell1 and cell2, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveAwayFromLine_2_arg_3: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveAwayFromLine_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveAwayFromLine_arg_1: The first cell of the line.
func_moveAwayFromLine_arg_2: The final cell of the line.
func_moveAwayFrom_return: The amount of MP spent doing so.
func_moveToward: Moves your leek closer to another leek.
func_moveToward_2: Moves your leek closer to another leek, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveToward_2_arg_1: The leek you want to get closer to.
func_moveToward_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveToward_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveToward_arg_1: The leek you want to get closer to.
func_moveTowardCell: Moves your leek closer to given cell.
func_moveTowardCell_2: Moves your leek closer to given cell, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveTowardCell_2_arg_1: The cell you want to get closer to.
func_moveTowardCell_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveTowardCell_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveTowardCell_arg_1: The cell you want to get closer to.
func_moveTowardCells: Moves your leek closer to a given group of cells.
func_moveTowardCells_2: Moves your leek closer to a given group of cells, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveTowardCells_2_arg_1: Array containing the cells to which you want to get closer.
func_moveTowardCells_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveTowardCells_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveTowardCells_arg_1: Array containing the cells to which you want to get closer.
func_moveTowardLeeks: Moves your leek closer to a given group of leeks.
func_moveTowardLeeks_2: Moves your leek closer to a given group of leeks, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveTowardLeeks_2_arg_1: Array containing the leeks to which you want to get closer.
func_moveTowardLeeks_2_arg_2: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveTowardLeeks_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveTowardLeeks_arg_1: Array containing the leeks to which you want to get closer.
func_moveTowardLine: Moves your leek towards the line between cell1 and cell2.
func_moveTowardLine_2: Moves your leek towards the line between cell1 and cell2, using at most mp Movement Points.
func_moveTowardLine_2_arg_1: The first cell of the line.
func_moveTowardLine_2_arg_2: The final cell of the line.
func_moveTowardLine_2_arg_3: The maximum amount of MP to spend.
func_moveTowardLine_2_return: The actual amount of MP spent.
func_moveTowardLine_arg_1: The first cell of the line.
func_moveTowardLine_arg_2: The final cell of the line.
func_number: Casts a value into a number. If the value is a string, this function attempts to convert it into a number. If the value is a number, this function returns the number. For any other type, this function returns null
func_pause: Pauses the fight, only for the pausing leek's farmer.
func_pop: Removes the last element of an array, and returns this element.
func_pow: Exponentiates a base number to the exp power.
func_push: Adds given element at the end of given array.
func_pushAll: Adds all elements from elements array at the end of given array.
func_rand: Returns a random real number, between 0 (included) and 1 (excluded).
func_randFloat: Returns a random real number, between a (included) and b (excluded).
func_randFloat_arg_1: The lower bound of the interval.
func_randFloat_arg_2: The upper bound of the interval.
func_randInt: Returns a random integer, between a (included) and b (excluded).
func_randInt_arg_1: The lower bound of the interval.
func_randInt_arg_2: The upper bound of the interval.
func_remove: Removes the element at given position from given array, and returns this element.
func_remove_arg_1: The array from which an element is removed.
func_remove_arg_2: The position of the element to remove.
func_removeElement: Removes the first occurrence of given element from given array. array is unchanged if element cannot be found.
func_removeElement_arg_1: The array from which an element is removed.
func_removeElement_arg_2: The element to look for and remove.
func_removeKey: Removes the element of given array associated with given key.
func_removeKey_arg_1: The array from which an element is removed.
func_removeKey_arg_2: The key of the element to remove.
func_replace: Replaces all occurrence of search string with replace string, within given string.
func_replace_arg_1: String inside which substitutions are performed.
func_resurrect: Uses CHIP_RESURRECTION to resurrect an entity of id entity on the cell cell.
func_resurrect_arg_1: The id of the entity to revive.
func_resurrect_arg_2: The cell on which the entity reappear
func_resurrect_return: The result of the launch of the chip, among USE_* constants.
func_round:
Computes the integer closest to a given number.
The rounded down value can be computed using #floor and the rounded up value using #ceil.
func_round_return: Rounded value of number, to the closest integer.
func_say: Allows your leek to talk. Costs one TP.
func_say_arg_1: Message your leek says, visible by all viewers of the fight.
func_search_2: Searches for given element inside given array, starting at start position.
func_search_2_return: The position of the first occurrence of given element inside given array starting at given start position, null if no match was found.
func_search_return: The position of the first occurrence of given element inside given array, null if no match was found.
func_sendAll: Sends a message to all of your allies.
func_sendAll_arg_1: The type of message to send (see MESSAGE_* constants).
func_sendAll_arg_2: The parameters of the message, which can take any form.
func_sendTo_arg_2: The type of message to send (see MESSAGE_* constants).
func_sendTo_arg_3: The parameters of the message, which can take any form.
func_setRegister: Stores given value in your leek's register, associated with given key. Given key and value are strings, respectively with maximum lengths of 100 and 5000 characters. A leek can have at most 100 distinct keys in its register, any additionnal (key:value) pair will not be stored if your leek's register is full.
func_setRegister_arg_1: Register key to index given value.
func_shift: Removes the first element of given array, and returns the corresponding element.
func_show: Shows all players given cell in black, for one turn. Costs one TP.
func_show_2: Shows all players given cell in given color, for one turn. Costs one TP.
func_signum_return: 1 if number is positive, 0 if it is 0 and -1 if it is negative.
func_sort:
Sorts given array, using the following order:
  • Booleans (false then true)
  • Numbers (least to greatest)
  • Strings (sorted alphabetically)
  • null elements
func_sort_2: Sorts given array, using the given order.
func_sort_2_arg_2: #SORT_ASC to sort from least to greatest, or #SORT_DESC to sort from greatest to least. More details in #sort (especially for multiple types arrays).
func_split: Splits given string into substrings separated by given delimiter.
func_split_2: Splits given string into substrings separated by given delimiter.
func_startsWith: Checks whether given string starts with given prefix.
func_startsWith_return: true if given string starts with given prefix, false otherwise.
func_string:
Casts a value to a string container.
Returns:
  • value if it is a string
  • "value" if it is a number
  • "[key1: value1, key2: value2... ...]" if value is an array
  • "true" or "false" if value is a boolean
  • "null" if value is null
.
func_subArray: Extracts a sub-array, starting at start position and ending at end position, from given array.
func_substring: Extracts a substring, starting at start position, from given string.
func_substring_2: Extracts a substring, starting at start position and of given length, from given string
func_sum: Computes the sum of all elements within given array.
func_summon: Uses given chip to summon the corresponding entity on given cell. The entity uses the AI contained in given ai function.
func_summon_arg_1: Desired chip. It has to be a summoning chip, equipped on the sumonning leek.
func_summon_arg_2: Cell where the summon should appear.
func_summon_arg_3: The sumonned entity's AI, as a function.
func_toDegrees: Converts given angle from radians to degrees.
func_toLower: Converts all capital letters from given string to lower characters.
func_toRadians: Converts given angle from degrees to radians.
func_toUpper: Converts all lower characters from given string to capital letters.
func_typeOf: Determines the type of given value, among: #TYPE_NULL, #TYPE_NUMBER, #TYPE_BOOLEAN, #TYPE_STRING, #TYPE_ARRAY, #TYPE_FUNCTION.
func_unshift: Adds given element at the beginning of given array.
func_useChip_return:
• #USE_CRITICAL, in case of critical hit
  • #USE_SUCCESS, in case of success
  • #USE_FAILED, in case of failure
  • #USE_INVALID_TARGET, if the target does not exist
  • #USE_NOT_ENOUGH_TP, if your leek does not have enough TP
  • #USE_INVALID_COOLDOWN, if given chip's cooldown is not expired
  • #USE_INVALID_POSITION, if the chip's range does not allow its use, or line of sight is not clear.
func_useWeapon: Fires your leek's weapon, targeting given leek.
func_useWeaponOnCell: Fires your leek's weapon, targeting given cell.
func_useWeapon_return:
• #USE_CRITICAL, in case of critical hit
  • #USE_SUCCESS, in case of success
  • #USE_FAILED, in case of failure
  • #USE_INVALID_TARGET, if the target does not exist
  • #USE_NOT_ENOUGH_TP, if your leek does not have enough TP
  • #USE_INVALID_POSITION, if the weapon's scope does not allow its use, or line of sight is not clear.
func_weaponNeedLos: Returns whether given weapon requires a line of sight in order to be shot.
func_weaponNeedLos_return: true if given weapon requires a line of sight, false otherwise.
getCellsToUseChipOnCell_2: Lists all cells that allow your leek to use a given chip, targeting given cell.
getCellsToUseChipOnCell_2_arg_1: The chip your leek wants to use.
title: Documentation
